intro: Cirrhopetalum biflorum, commonly known as the two-flowered cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
